report_title: Industry Report on Lotteries and Native American Casinos
executive_summary: Lotteries and Native American casinos are referring to gambling facilities, and do not include casino hotels or hotels that provide gambling services. Gambling and wagering represent luxury expenditures to most consumers, with the level of gambling primarily driven by the state of the economy. In periods of economic growth, lotteries and Native American casinos benefit from low unemployment levels, which drive growth in per capita disposable income. In contrast, recessionary periods cause the majority of consumers to opt against gambling in favor of reducing discretionary spending. Over the last few years, industry revenue grew at a CAGR of 5.5% to $198.9 billion, including an expected 3.3% rise in 2024.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Volatile Economic Conditions During the Pandemic Highlight Importance of Stability
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Since the industry relies heavily on strong consumer confidence and steady travel activity, the pandemic notably dampened growth for the industry, as consumers cut back on discretionary spending.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Growth Decelerates in the Next Few Years
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Despite heightened inflationary pressures in the current period, the industry demonstrated some countercyclical growth.

industry_definition: This industry comprises establishments primarily engaged in operating gambling facilities, except casinos or casino hotels, or providing gambling services.

positive_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: high - steady

key_trends: Heightened travel activity fuels demand for gambling facilities and lottery tickets.
